title: Làm bài luyện đọc | Luyện đề VSTEP

reading.title: Làm bài luyện đọc | Luyện đề VSTEP

passages.content:
Câu 1: The word "coined" in paragraph (A) could best be replaced by?
A. created
B. mentioned
C. understood
D. discovered
Câu 2: The word "intervention" in paragraph (A) can best be replaced by?
A. source
B. device
C. influence
D. need
Câu 3: The word "it" in paragraph (A) refers to?
A. light bulb
B. atom
C. energy
D. molecule
Câu 4: Which of the following statements best describes a laser?
A. An instrument for measuring light waves
B. A technique for destroying atoms or molecules
C. A device for stimulating atoms and molecules to emit light
D. An atom in a high-energy state
Câu 5: Why was Towne's early work with stimulated emission done with microwaves?
A. It was easier to work with longer wavelengths.
B. The laser had already been developed.
C. He was not concerned with light amplification.
D. His partner Schawlow had already begun work on the laser.
Câu 6: In his research at Columbia University, Charles Townes worked with all of the following EXCEPT?
A. microwaves
B. stimulated emission
C. light waves
D. a maser
Câu 7: In approximately what year was the first maser built?
A. 1953
B. 1957
C. 1951
D. 1917
Câu 8: The word "emerged" in paragraph (B) is closest in meaning to?
A. succeeded
B. appeared
C. increased
D. concluded
Câu 9: The word "outlining" in paragraph (B) is closest in meaning to?
A. studying
B. summarizing
C. assigning
D. checking
Câu 10: Why do people still argue about who deserves the credit for the concept of the laser?
A. The researchers' notebooks were lost.
B. The work is still incomplete.
C. No one claimed credit for the development until recently.
D. Multiple researchers were independently working on the concept at the same time.

options.A: An instrument for measuring light waves
options.B: A technique for destroying atoms or molecules
options.C: A device for stimulating atoms and molecules to emit light
options.D: An atom in a high-energy state

options.A: It was easier to work with longer wavelengths.
options.B: The laser had already been developed.
options.C: He was not concerned with light amplification.
options.D: His partner Schawlow had already begun work on the laser.

options.C: No one claimed credit for the development until recently.
options.D: Multiple researchers were independently working on the concept at the same time.
